document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the plant bug genus Cylapocoris Carvalho (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Miridae: Cylapinae), with descriptions of seven new species from Costa Rica, Brazil, Ecuador, and Venezuela

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the plant bug genus Cylapocoris Carvalho (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Miridae: Cylapinae), with descriptions of seven new species from Costa Rica, Brazil, Ecuador, and Venezuela

subSubSection.paragraph:
( Figures 11 , 61 ,
85–89
,
Table 1
)

Cylapocoris sulinus Carvalho & Gomes 1971 : 486
, 488, figs 2–5 (n.sp), Carvalho & Froeschner 1987 : 154 (list); Schuh 1995 : 22 (catalog); Paula & Ferreira 1998 : 44 (list); Gorczyca 2006 b: 28 (catalog).

Measurements (based on Carvalho & Gomes 1971 and single ZSM specimen; holotype measurements in parentheses): Body . Length 4.2–4.3 / 3.9–4.3 ( 4.3 ), width 1.7–1.9 / 1.4–1.5 ( 1.5 ). Head . Length 0.4–0.6 / 0.3–0.58 ( 0.3 ), width 0.8 –1.0/ 0.95 –1.0 (1.0), interocular distance 0.48 / 0.32–0.33 ( 0.32 ). Antenna . Length of segment I 0.3– 0.5 / 0.38–0.4 ( 0.4 ), II 1.0– 1.2 /1.0– 1.1 (1.0), III 0.5–0.6 / 0.2–0.63 ( 0.2 ), IV 0.8 / 0.2–0.75 ( 0.2 ). Labium . Immeasurable in the ZSM specimen. Pronotum . Length 0.6–0.8 / 0.6–0.74 ( 0.6 ), width of anterior margin (ZSM male specimen) 0.65 , length of lateral margin (ZSM male specimen) 0.65 , width of posterior margin 1.6 / 1.4–1.45 ( 1.4 ).
Biology . Unknown, collected in black light traps (Paula & Ferreira 1998 ).

Type material.
Holotype ♂: Brasilien , Nova Teutônia,
27 º 11 ’S
, 52 º, 23 ’L,
XI- 1944
, Fritz Plaumann (deposited in Museu Nacional, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil , not examined).

Additional examined material .
1 ♂
: Nova Teutônia, Santa Catarina, Brasil ,
15.11 . 1944
( ZSM ) (
Fig. 11
).

subSubSection.paragraph: Species Location

Brasil (Amazonas)

sp. nov. Costa Rica (Heredia)

sp. nov. Costa Rica (Heredia)

Panama , Costa Rica (Guanacasta)

sp. nov. Venezuela (Amazonas)

sp. nov. Costa Rica (Cartago: Turrialba)

Brasil (Amazonas, Mato Grosso)

sp. nov. Costa Rica (Puntarenas)

Salvador (San Vincente)

sp. nov. Brasil (Amazonas), Ecuador (Orellana), Venezuela (Amazonas)
Cylapocoris sulinus Carvalho & Gomes, 1971

Brasil (Amazonas), Peru (Tambopata)
